qas.question: What kind of University is Imperial College London?

plausible_answers.text: during its one hundred year anniversary

qas.question: When did the Imerial Institute join the University of London?

context: <b5_0>Imperial College London<b5_0/> is a <a0_0>public research university<a0_0/> located in London, United Kingdom. It was founded by <a1_0><b6_0>Prince Albert<b6_0/><a1_0/> who envisioned an area composed of the Natural History Museum, Science Museum, Victoria and Albert Museum, Royal Albert Hall and the Imperial Institute. The Imperial Institute was opened by his wife, <a2_0><b7_0>Queen Victoria<b7_0/><a2_0/>, who laid the first stone. In 1907, Imperial College London was formed by <a3_0>Royal Charter<a3_0/>, and soon joined the University of London, with a focus on <a4_0>science and technology<a4_0/>. The college has expanded its coursework to medicine through mergers with St Mary's Hospital. In <b8_0>2004<b8_0/>, Queen Elizabeth II opened the Imperial College Business School. Imperial became an independent university from the University of London <b9_0>during its one hundred year anniversary<b9_0/>.
